Description: Body sherd and end of horizontal reflex handle of Chian two-handled pottery jar; white slip; interior: reserved; exterior: above on left, part of floral pattern, perhaps guilloche; handle worn, perhaps vertical bars; below, band of short vertical strokes above rays.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1924,1201.179 and 1924,1201.180. For parallels regarding the shape, see Lemos no. 1641 from Rizari and no. 1647 from Olbia.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2157) (phase 2)
